1.content:
You woke up. "Ah, thank God it's Sunday," you say to yourself. You get up and stretch, and jump off from your bed.

As soon as you do, something feels off. You feel lighter.
Look at yourself, and you see that you're transparent.

"What the hell?" you say to yourself. You turn back and see your real body is lying there, motionless.

"HOLY CRAP, I'M DEAD!" you say.
A few seconds later, your body gets up, acting as it normally would. This strikes you as odd, even a bit scary.

You realize that it's on autopilot, in a way. "It's acting like the real me...maybe...maybe there's a copy of me in there? But why?"

And then it hit you, after putting two and two together.

"I must have the ability to possess others!"

You just had to try it out. But who shall we test this on?

"Typical," you say to yourself. You always were the last to wake, no matter what.

In front of the stove was your mom. She was in her mid 30s, and really beautiful. She had a nice figure, and she was pretty fashionable. She was also a stay at home mom. She was currently sporting a white sundress with flip flops.

Sitting at the head of the table was your dad, who was reading the newspaper and eating his breakfast. Late 30s, and quite handsome. He worked out on occasion; he was even the star quarterback when he was in high school. He was currently wearing a light blue button up shirt, with khaki shorts and white socks.

Sitting a seat away from him was your older sister, Christina. She was staying at home for a bit so she could save up for college. She was 21, and really beautiful. She, like her mother, had a nice figure. She currently works at a clothing shop at the mall, but had the day off, like the rest of the family. She was currently wearing a pink polo shirt, a white knee length skirt, and high heeled sandals.

Next to her was your little sister, Marie. She was 12, and in the 6th grade. She was pretty cute, and you know she would grow up to be beautiful, along with her sister and mom. She was wearing a light blue tank top, denim shorts, and flip flops.

Who would be your first test?
